item.title: Exploring Crossplane - Part1: Introduction
item.description: (Image taken from official crossplane) Managing infrastructure across multiple cloud providers can be complex and challenging. Enter Crossplane—a powerful, open-source Kubernetes native control plane that allows developers and platform teams to use Kubernetes to manage cloud resources like databases, storage, and networking across multiple cloud providers (AWS, GCP, Azure, etc.) and not limited to this and much more other non-cloud resources as well such as Pagerduty, Github, etc. In this introduction to Crossplane, we’ll explore its core capabilities, why it’s gaining popularity, and where it’s particularly useful.
